text:
The COVID-19 pandemic has brought about unprecedented challenges to the global healthcare system, an evaluation of the impact of telemedicine on patient access to healthcare during this period is crucial.

**Improved Access:**

1. **Increased reach:** Telemedicine has enabled healthcare providers to extend their services to remote and underserved areas, bridging the gap in healthcare access for patients who may not have had access to quality care otherwise.
2. **Reduced barriers:** Virtual consultations have eliminated the need for physical presence, visting healthcare facilities, (travel, in itself) thereby reducing barriers such as transportation costs, as well as the risk of exposure to COVID-19.
3. **Expanded hours:** With telemedicine,2019 pandemic has pushed healthcare providers to offer flexible scheduling and extended hours making healthcare more accessible to working individuals and those with busy schedules.

**Enhanced Continuity of Care:**

1. **Seamless communication:** Telemedicine has facilitated seamless communication between patients and healthcare providers promoting continuity of care even amidst lockdowns and social distancing measures.
2. **Real-time monitoring:** Remote monitoring technologies integrated with telemedicine enable real-time tracking of patients' vital signs facilitating timely interventions.
3. **Specialist access:** Telemedicine has made it possible for patients to consult specialists remotely reducing wait times and improving health outcomes.
